Package org.usfirst.frc.team1072.robot.subsystems

Class Drivetrain

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SendableBase
      • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.Subsystem
        • org.usfirst.frc.team1072.robot.subsystems.Drivetrain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Sendable
    public class Drivetrain
extends edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.Subsystem
    Represents a drive train with two Talons and two Victors.
    Version:
    6/11/18
    Author:
    Finn Frankis

      Moves the robot left and right sides to given positions using PID.

      Runs both motor controllers given a velocity and turn.
      void clearTrajectoryPoints()
      Clears trajectory points from both talons.
      void configBothFeedbackSensors​(com.ctre.phoenix.motorcontrol.FeedbackDevice fd, int pidLoop)
      Configures both Talons to point to a given sensor.
      void configureAngleClosedLoop()
      Configures the angle closed loop for turning in place.
      void configureMotionProfileAngleClosedLoop()
      Configures the angle closed loop for motion profiling.
      void configureMotionProfileDriveClosedLoop()
      Configures the motion profile closed loop.
      void configureNominalPeakOutputs()
      Configures the nominal and peak outputs for the two Talons, where nominal output is the minimum percent which can be applied (without breaking static friction) and peak output is the maximum percent which can be applied.
      private void configurePositionClosedLoop()
      Configures the drivetrain position closed loop.
      private void configureVelocityClosedLoop()
      Configures the drivetrain velocity closed loop.
      private void dtSetCurrentLimit​(int peakCurrentLimit, int peakTime, int continuousLimit)
      Sets a current limit for the left and right talons on the drivetrain.
      private void dtsetTalonFramePeriods()
      Resets the Talon frame periods (the frequency at which the Talons will broadcast certain status frames along the CAN bus).

      Gets the instance of this Drivetrain, creating a new one if necessary.

      Inverts the Talons and Victors to account for wiring inconsistencies (must be tested).

      Determines whether the closed loop error for both sides is within a given value.

      Prints the closed loop error of the Talons in a given loop.

      Prints the sensor positions of the Talons in a given loop.

      Performs teleop-specific commands on the Talon.

      Slaves the Victors to directly follow the behavior of their parent talons.

      • arcadeDriveVelocity

        public void arcadeDriveVelocity​(double speed,
                                double turn)
        Runs both motor controllers given a velocity and turn.
        Parameters:
        speed - the speed at which the controllers should run
        turn - the amount by which each speed should be modified to account for turn

                                double rightTarget)
        Moves the robot left and right sides to given positions using PID.
        Parameters:
        leftTarget - the target position for the left side
        rightTarget - the target position for the right side

        private void setTalonDeadbands()

        Sets both talons to a given value.
        Parameters:
        cm - the ControlMode to which both talons will be set (like PercentOutput, Velocity, Position, or Disabled)
        value - the value to which both talons will be set

        pidLoop - the loop index (primary/auxiliary) [0,1]

      • setRampTime

        private void setRampTime​(double t)
        Configure the talons to ramp gradually to peak voltage.
        Parameters:
        t - the ramp time (time from 0 voltage to max)

      • scaleVoltage

        private void scaleVoltage​(double nomVoltage)
        Scales the voltage to modify percent output to account for the battery voltage loss.
        Parameters:
        nomVoltage - the assumed nominal voltage, used to scale relative to battery voltage

      • setTalonSensorPhase

        public void setTalonSensorPhase​(boolean leftPhase,
                                boolean rightPhase)
        Aligns the sensor phase of the encoders to match the motions of the motors.
        Parameters:
        leftPhase - the left sensor phase
        rightPhase - the right sensor phase

      • configureVelocityClosedLoop

        private void configureVelocityClosedLoop()
        Configures the drivetrain velocity closed loop.

      • configureNominalPeakOutputs

        public void configureNominalPeakOutputs()
        Configures the nominal and peak outputs for the two Talons, where nominal output is the minimum percent which can be applied (without breaking static friction) and peak output is the maximum percent which can be applied.

      • configurePositionClosedLoop

        private void configurePositionClosedLoop()
        Configures the drivetrain position closed loop.

      • selectProfileSlots

        public void selectProfileSlots​(int pidSlot,
                               int pidIndex)
        Selects the profile slots of both talons to their correct places.
        Parameters:
        pidSlot - the PID slot on the Talon [0, 3]
        pidIndex - the PID index (primary/auxiliary or inner/outer) [0, 1]

      • configureAngleClosedLoop

        public void configureAngleClosedLoop()

      • dtsetTalonFramePeriods

        private void dtsetTalonFramePeriods()
        Resets the Talon frame periods (the frequency at which the Talons will broadcast certain status frames along the CAN bus).

      • dtSetCurrentLimit

        private void dtSetCurrentLimit​(int peakCurrentLimit,
                               int peakTime,
                               int continuousLimit)
        Sets a current limit for the left and right talons on the drivetrain.
        Parameters:
        peakCurrentLimit - the peak current limit (only temporary)
        peakTime - the time for which the peak current limit is allowed
        continuousLimit - the continuous limit (represents the limit after peakTime passes)

      • setPigeonYaw

        public void setPigeonYaw​(double angle)
        Sets the pigeon yaw to a given value.
        Parameters:
        angle - the angle value to which the pigeon should be set, in pigeon units where 1 rotation is 8192 units

      • addPigeonYaw

        public void addPigeonYaw​(double angle)
        Adds a given value to the pigeon yaw.
        Parameters:
        angle - the angle value which should be added to the pigeon yaw value, in pigeon units where 1 rotation is 8192 units

                                      int pidLoop)
        Configures both Talons to point to a given sensor.
        Parameters:
        fd - the type of sensor to which the Talon should use
        pidLoop - the loop index where this sensor should be placed [0,1]

      • isClosedLoopErrorWithin

        public boolean isClosedLoopErrorWithin​(int loopIndex,
                                       double allowableError)
        Determines whether the closed loop error for both sides is within a given value.
        Parameters:
        loopIndex - the loop index, either primary or auxiliary [0,1]
        allowableError - the error tolerance to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the absolute value of the error is within the value; false otherwise
